intro: Pleiocarpidia pilosa, commonly known as the hairy pleiocarpidia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, palmate leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, aiding in seed dispersal.
